thread.title: G8 Education chairwoman Jenny Hutson resigns after five years at helm
thread.title_full: G8 Education chairwoman Jenny Hutson resigns after five years at helm | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: JOHN CONROY
title: G8 Education chairwoman Jenny Hutson resigns after five years at helm
text:
G8 Education chairwoman Jenny Hutson will step down from the board next month after the company's bid for Affinity Education was topped by a rival offer.
Ms Hutson has led the company through a period of rapid expansion as it has pursued acquisitions, but the group's most recent takeover offer fell short.
Affinity received and backed a higher bid from Anchorage Capital Partners.
“Having led the proposed acquisition of Affinity Education it is time for me to step aside and for there to be renewal at board level,” she said.
Matthew Reynolds will act as chairman for an interim period while a replacement is identified to lead the company.
Mr Reynolds said Ms Hutson, who will step down on October 15 after more than five years on the board, had overseen G8's transformation “from a small listed company to a significant operator in the childcare and education sector”.
G8 now one of the biggest providers of education and childcare in Australia and has a growing presence in Singapore.
It boasts more than 450 childcare centres and can accept 33,000 students.
Mr Scott said Ms Hutson's five-year reign had seen the company declare and pay quarterly dividends since 2010 and record 10 consecutive periods of relative outperformance compared with prior periods.
Last month the company reported increased half-year earnings, with the group's profit rising 73 per cent to $28.24 million compared with the same period a year earlier.
 G8 Education chairwoman quits
